text: When you upvote and it redirects you to your accounts, select one of your accounts to associate your user session with. You can pick any of them. Then it will ask you to confirm and then you can go back to the community and upvote or post messages. It’s not very intuitive and probably could use some prompts.

Is the create blog post API down? I found this which was posted yesterday. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Can-t-create-a-new-blog-post-Not-engaged-auth-is-missing/m-p/379973#M37353>

Does anybody know if this is a known issue and if it’s gonna be fixed anytime soon?

Thank you for the reply. It seems v3 would require 2 API calls to fetch 1 set of contacts, and the process seems a bit roundabout too.

I checked the legacydocs and decided to move to deals v1 API for this case. It provides simple solution for my case, and it seems to have some advantages over v3.

- 'since' parameter to fetch deals created after a particular time.
- 250 records fetched in 1 API call along with associations, while v3 fetches 100 records and requires 2 API calls (to include associations).

Would this be addressed in v3? I don't understand why the 'since' parameter has been removed from the deals v3 API. And would v1 be deprecated soon?
I believe they are constantly adding features that they provided in previous iterations of API's. I think what you see right now is their MVP.

When I make a call via Python to get all my companies, I am only getting 250 contacts. If I set the max to 500, I get 500, but HubSpot duplicates the companies. So halving that would still only be 250. If I set the max for 1000, I get 1000, but HubSpot quadruples the values (meaning I'm still only getting 250 unique values). I should have 340 companies. Any ideas why HubSpot would do this? It seems to not be paginating properly or something.
Hey <@UPK28EM89>, <@U7TAZ6V2Q>, taking a look at this.  I am returning the same error.  Will respond here once I have an update
Thank you!
:thumbsup:
Oh... I thought this was the final version of v3 since it has been out of preview and available to general public for a few months now. Then I hope this feature gets added soon too.
here is the change log
You can subscribe to it as well
Hi guys! Does anyone know how to get a list of all currencies via HubSpot API?
Looks like the problem was resolved. The CREATE endpoint is working again!
I'm not sure if the API supports that but you could always create deals in all the currencies available and do a get request on those deals and see what you get.
Hi Guys! Does anyone know how to convert unix milliseconds timestamp (1603226508084) to MM/DD/YYYY
We are good to go!
Thanks for quickly pointing out the issue!
What program are you wanting to convert it from?
is there an endpoint where i could see lead score change history for a specific contact?
Thanks. Yeah. I’ve seen those posts too.
They are still doing more
probably some security challenges on this one, non-trivial
Did you try ISO8601?
closedate is weird, it does not behave the same as other fields as it is in a weird legacy timestamp driven format
probably need to raise a bug on this
<@UD53A9UUR> ?
It was supposed to quit working in Jan, not now, must have had something go haywire on a code push on their side maybe?

At least in the email I received:

"With the release of this new endpoint, we're requiring integrations to switch to this new endpoint by January 15, 2021."
So that should not have broken yet, unless something else was the cause.
There are some limits on pagination size, maybe something weird happens when you go past them
Somebody else asked this week, not much luck so far, not on two community posts either
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/how-should-timestamps-be-formatted-for-HubSpots-apis>
After that, language specific

yeah, this was just mentioned in the community as well.  initially i was concerned with an inconsistency with the time stamp, but there seems to be something deeper that needs to be investigated.   cc <@UFBNA9K9A>

Turns out that for Companies I need to set the `offset` in order for it to paginate properly. I put `offset = 250` after the limit and it worked. As for Deals, the it was a combination of setting the offset and has more needed to be `hasMore` instead of `has-more`. It looks to me like the code in the documentation has some errors in it.

Hey all, I’m troubleshooting an issue where I’ve got contacts getting created without any tracking info despite the Tracking Cookie/User Token being passed via the Forms API with the hutk parameter.

We are also passing the tracking cookie as a form field so that we can know for sure if a tracking cookie was available on signup.

I’m working with two examples where as per HubSpot, no tracking info was passed, despite the cookie being available since it was passed as a form field by the same API call that would have included it in the hs_context parameter.

I created a new form with just the email as a field, and I am trying to pass the same cookie for the users again, using an IP address that matches the location of the user, but no luck. Even this new form, with the code you see below, form submission complains that no cookie or IP was passed. Any ideas?
